page.title: 06ST.PETERS CHURCH,BICKENHILL
page.content: ST.PETERS CHURCH BICKENHILL WAS BUILT AROUND 1100 B.C. AND IS OF NORMAN ORIGIN.THE RECTOR AT ST.PETERS IS THE REV.STANLEY OWEN AND HAS BEEN THE RECTOR FOR THE LAST 27 YEARS.THE REV. OWEN IS ALSO RECTOR OF ELMDON PARISH CHURCH.ST PETERS CHURCH IS USED MAINLY BY THE LOCAL VILLAGERS OF BICKENHILL, OF WHICH THE POPULATION IS 200 PEOPLE. THE AVERAGE CONGREGATION FOR THE SUNDAY SEVICE AT ST.PETERS IS 60 TO 70 PEOPLE.NEAR TO ST.PETERS CHURCH THERE HAS BEEN THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE N.E.C AND THE METROPOLE HOTEL.VISITORS TO THE N.E.C AND THE METROPOLE OFTEN USE ST.PETERS AS A PLACE OF WORSHIP. THE STEEPLED CLOCK TOWER OF ST.PETERS HAS TO DISPLAY AIRCRAFT WARNING LIGHTS BECAUSE OF HOW CLOSE IT IS TO BIRMINGHAM AIRPORT.WITHIN RECENT YEARS THERE HAS BEEN AN EXTENSION BUILT UPON THE CHURCH WHICH SERVES AS A VESTRY.
